title: Chinese Solar Greenhouse over PTES - Detailed Technical Cross Section v2
subtitle: Enklava Project | Łódź, Poland | 100% Solar Heating for 4 Houses
scene_description: Ultra-detailed technical cross-section of a Chinese passive solar greenhouse built directly above an underground Pit Thermal Energy Storage (PTES) tank. View is from the EAST looking WEST, showing the full north-south span. The section reveals all construction layers with photorealistic materials and accurate proportions. Background shows Polish winter landscape with snow.

overall_dimensions.total_height: 5.5m from pit bottom to greenhouse peak
overall_dimensions.viewing_angle: true horizontal cross-section, no perspective distortion

Membrane welded to wall EPDM for complete seal

construction_layers_from_bottom_to_top.name: TIMBER FLOOR STRUCTURE

labeling_requirements.style: Technical drawing callouts with leader lines
labeling_requirements.font: Sans-serif, high contrast (white text on dark background or black text on light)
critical_labels: EPDM VAPOR SEAL - clearly pointing to black ceiling line
AIR GAP 200mm - pointing to empty space above EPDM
WALL COLLECTORS 20m² - pointing to interior-mounted panels
WALL HEATING PEX - pointing to orange serpentine pipes
THERMAL BLANKET - pointing to rolled fabric between polycarbonate
GLULAM BEAMS - pointing to timber spanning wall-to-wall
THERMAL STRATIFICATION - pointing to temperature gradient in water

critical_visual_emphasis.instruction: Draw as THICK BLACK LINE (5-8px) at -0.3m depth, clearly separating water below from air gap above. This line must be unmistakably visible.
Show as EMPTY SPACE 200mm high between black EPDM line and timber joists. Use light background color to emphasize emptiness. Add small air circulation arrows.
Show dark blue/black flat plate collectors MOUNTED ON INTERIOR FACE of north wall. They face south INTO the greenhouse. Include copper pipe connections.
Show ORANGE PEX PIPES in serpentine pattern embedded in the clay plaster layer of north wall interior. These are SEPARATE from the solar collectors.
Show rolled-up insulating blanket as a VISIBLE CYLINDER at the top of the glazing, positioned BETWEEN the two polycarbonate layers. Include deployment tracks.
Show beams spanning the FULL WIDTH from north to south wall, resting on concrete ring beam. NO POSTS IN THE WATER.

legend_box.title: SYSTEM SPECIFICATIONS
content: Construction: Timber + EPDM sealed (no steel in water)

info_box.title: KEY INNOVATIONS
content: ✓ Greenhouse heated FREE by PTES below
✓ EPDM ceiling seals vapor from timber
✓ Wall heating for comfortable radiant warmth
✓ No heat pump needed - direct solar to water

technical_notes: Glulam beams GL28h rated for 8.5m span with 5kN/m² load
Polycarbonate R-value: 1.8 (16mm triple) + blanket = R-8 at night
Thermal stratification maintained by careful diffuser placement

generation_instructions.lighting: Winter daylight from south, warm glow from water storage
generation_instructions.detail_level: Maximum - show all construction layers clearly
generation_instructions.label_clarity: All labels LARGE, READABLE, high contrast
generation_instructions.emphasis: Make EPDM ceiling, air gap, wall collectors, and wall heating pipes the most visible elements after the main structure
avoid: Do not show posts or supports inside the water volume
Do not merge wall heating and wall collectors into one element
Do not skip the air gap between EPDM and timber
Do not make EPDM lines too thin - they must be visible
